titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. John Sauner and George Kentner, Indictment
CWG7597

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
McCracken Circuit Court
The Commonwealth of Kentucky
against
John Sauner & Geo. Kentner

The Grand Jury of McCracken County in the name and by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky accuse John Sauner & George Kentner of the offense of Keeping a gaming house, as follows -- The said Sauner and Kentner did on the 1st day of May 1865 suffer and permit a game of farro & with dice at which money bank bills & property of value was bet won & lost to be played in a house under their Control against the peace and dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

Witnesses
M. K. Harris
Wm Johson
Wm Sullivan
Stanley Brown
John Stroud
John Hord
Frank Harlan

Endorsed
A true Bill
J. G. Cole
foreman"
Bail is fixed on this Indictment at Two hundred Dollars for each

"A Copy attest
B. Small c m c c
By Henry. C. Yeiser D C

State of Kentucky
McCracken County } John Sauner S

McCracken Cir Ct
Coml
vs } G. House
Jno Sauner & others
